content.json.content: {"name":"Sergio Marin","nick_name":"highercomve","tagline":"I'm a software engineer focused on web applications","location":"Santiago, Chile","networks":[{"title":"Sergio Marin's Github page","url":"https://github.com/highercomve","icon":"github"},{"title":"Sergio Marin's Gitlab page","url":"https://gitlab.com/highercomve","icon":"gitlab"},{"title":"Sergio Marin's LinkedIn page","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/highercomve/","icon":"linkedin-in"},{"title":"Sergio Marin's Medium blog","url":"https://medium.com/@highercomve","icon":"medium"},{"title":"Sergio Marin's Twitter","url":"https://twitter.com/highercomve","icon":"twitter"}],"about_me":{"title":"","content":["A decade ago, my journey in programming and web development began with a fortuitous encounter - delving into the open-source code of an MU web server scripted in PHP for a renowned MMORPG game. This initial exploration ignited a fervent passion for coding intricacies and the vast potential of the digital realm.","Since then, my career trajectory has been dedicated to web development, fueled by an enduring commitment to crafting solutions that address real-world challenges and enhance user experiences. The web platform, to me, serves as an expansive canvas for creativity and innovation, affording users seamless access to software across diverse devices and operating systems without installation barriers.","Throughout my professional tenure, I have navigated diverse domains within the web platform ecosystem, encompassing the development of robust APIs, dynamic front-end applications, and server-rendered apps, alongside adept data processing and seamless user integration with third-party services.","Each endeavor has been a crucible for growth, driving continuous learning and adaptation to the evolving web landscape. Every day presents an opportunity to explore emerging technologies and refine my craft."],"wrapper":"p"},"aims":{"title":"My aims?","content":["Continually learning and adapting to emerging technologies","Gaining fresh perspectives and approaches to app development","Mentoring others and facilitating collaborative problem-solving","Creating solutions that adhere to best practices and generate transferrable knowledge for future teams"],"wrapper":"li"},"skils":{"title":"Technical skills","content":["Golang","Javascript","Kubernetes","Docker","Node.js","Linux","Bash","Apache","Nginx","Git","React","Vue.js","State management libraries","Web Components","Ruby","Amazon web services","Front-end automatization tools","HTML / CSS","MySQL","MongoDB","PostgreSQL"],"wrapper":"li"},"talks":{"title":"Talks","content":["La Plata JS - December 2018 (http://slides.com/highercomve/web-components). The current state of the web components in the browser, and how we can use them today."],"wrapper":"li"}}

experience.json.content: {"items":[{"title":"Senior Software Engineer - Pantacor","label":"March 2019 - Today","subtitle":"pantahub.com - Golang/React/Shell","description":["At Pantacor, I am an integral part of a dynamic team dedicated to the development of the Pantacor platform, a pioneering open-source project designed to revolutionize the management of software and firmware for Edge Services on Linux devices.","My responsibilities encompass the development and enhancement of CLI tools, web services, and web applications, leveraging a sophisticated tech stack including Golang, React, and Shell scripting. Notably, I have played a pivotal role in the creation of the fleet.pantacor.com application, a cornerstone of our platform. This groundbreaking application facilitates the seamless management of device fleets, enabling the deployment and maintenance of thousands of devices with unparalleled ease and reliability.","Through my contributions, I have significantly advanced the functionality and usability of the Pantacor platform, empowering organizations to breathe new life into existing Linux-based device deployments while ushering in a new era of value-added services and comprehensive management solutions."]},{"title":"Technical Lead - uBiome","label":"October 2018 - January 2019","subtitle":"ubiome.com - Product Team","description":["As Technical Lead for the product team, I lead the creation and implementation of a new set of tools and rules for several applications.","Creating an ecosystem for the company to allow the frontend team to move faster and scale better. Building libraries and components for our Vue.js applications, a general configuration, and tools to allow developers to do TDD in an easy way, CI integrations, tracking application performance, A/B testing.","Two achievements at uBiome were lead the migration from meteor to Vue.js in 5 applications and accomplish to reduce our application load time from 30 seconds to 5 seconds after a performance review of our applications done by me."]},{"title":"Senior Software Engineer - uBiome","label":"June 2017 - October 2018","subtitle":"ubiome.com - Product Team - Node and Vue.js","description":["I was part of the product team as a frontend developer, we maintain and create all the applications used for patients and doctor to interact with our products. Starting requesting a kit for the study and ends with the visualization of results and reports.","I was in charge of creating a culture and infrastructure to build our applications using TDD as a common practice, for this matter I give several internal presentations about TDD with Vue.js. And I set up all the pipeline to run the test suit in our CI (Drone), integrate that with our Repositories and set the rules to allow merging new features only if the test pass."]},{"title":"Senior Software Engineer - Payfully","label":"June 2016 - May 2017","subtitle":"payfully.co- Node and React","description":["I was the first contracted developer after the CTO did the first MVP of the application, therefore together we built all the bases for the whole company. After I was in charge of training all the new developers in the company and I built the infrastructure of microservices with Amazon Lambda and Node.js, creating a Yeoman template for our new services adding to all the tools that we were using as Typescript, Mocha, Mocks of other services, Mocks for Amazon SQS.","I was the lead developer on the creation of the new React applications (web, mobile -React native- and the administration platform), setting al the rules and tools that the team was gonna in the building process and creating all the base code base for those applications (all the basic features that we already got in the previous applications)."]},{"title":"Software Developer - Retiqueta","label":"2015 - 2016","subtitle":"retiqueta.com - Ruby and Javascript","description":["My main responsibility was to build the mobile application with Ionic, but also work on the API with RoR. The application has features such as push notifications, camera usage, in-app payments, and other features to create the best experience to sell and buy second-hand clothing and accessories. We use docker and Kubernetes to build our architecture over Google Cloud Container Engine and orchestrate that container cluster. All this with continuous integration and testing in our API, and also testing in the mobile app with Calabash (http://calaba.sh/) and Cucumber.  "]},{"title":"Technical Lead - Escuelaweb","label":"2012 - 2015","subtitle":"escuelaweb.net - Ruby on Rails and HTML/CSS/JS","description":["I was the technical lead in charge of all the systems, infrastructure, servers, services, integrations, and I lead other developers in the company.","Escuelaweb.net has a platform where students can take exams, read class materials, receive job offers, etc. The user participates in live classes, where students and teachers interact via video, audio, chat, files, and more.,","My biggest accomplishment here as Senior Engineer here was the opportunity to meet awesome developers which thanks to all that they learn in escuelaweb as part of the development team, they got the chance to have incredible growth as a developer leading them to find a job outside Venezuela and have a better life. And until now, they have always thanked me for that and the job as their leader in escuelaweb."]},{"title":"Software Engineer - Escuelaweb","label":"2008 - 2012","subtitle":"escuelaweb.net - PHP/HTML/CSS/JS/RoR","description":["As part of the development team of escuelaweb I was in charge of several projects, some of them in PHP, others in Ruby on Rails, and others in WordPress.","Projects like lapatilla.com a news website with high traffic, embarazada.com a web application to help pregnant women in their journey.","Technologies used: WordPress, RoR, JavaScript, AngularJS, Grunt, Docker, Dokku, Bootstrap, SASS, Ajax, Restful API."]}]}
